name: Neema
all_locations: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
long_description: Neema is an app that helps people manage their money as well as send money to other people. Neema is a financial solution for 70 million underbanked Americans. Users download their app, which is a digital wallet, where they can cash their own pay check, send money internationally to their families in 90 countries, and they also provide them with a debit card, which they can use in any store or ATM.
one_liner: Neema is an app for unbanked workers, which provides a checking…

name: Swadesh
all_locations: New York, NY, USA; New Delhi, DL, India
long_description:
We offer a free US FDIC Insured Checking account, Free Credit Card (no interest rate, collateral, fees), Free AT&T SIM Card shipped to home with 40%+ cheaper plans than retail, and save thousands of dollars in remittances to our customers - all by opening a free Swadesh Account. 

We enable new to America expats become "American" in the eyes of the US Financial system. 
We're starting by serving the 150,000+ Indian expats migrating to the US each year. 

We have a comprehensive solution that covers banking, credit building, communication, remittance, as well as value-add services such as insurance, housing etc. along with all the standard bells and whistles of neobanks.
one_liner: We setup Immigrants with a free US Bank Account, Credit Card, SIM…

name: Afriex
long_description: Afriex makes it easy for immigrants to send money home.  We offer instant, low-fee remittances to over 25 countries around the world.

name: Coba
all_locations: Monterrey, N.L., Mexico; Austin, TX, USA
long_description:
Coba makes it easy for Mexican knowledge workers employed by US companies to earn in US Dollars and seamlessly spend locally in Pesos.

On average, a knowledge worker will lose $1,000 per year in hidden ForEx and transfer fees. In that process, their money will touch at least 3 different accounts adding time and steps along the way. These workers’ require more than simple money movement, they demand a financial solution that addresses their specific needs: banking, saving, spending - all in two currencies.

Coba allows its users to not only deposit and save their earnings in a US account, but also access critical financial services at home in Mexico - from a local credit card to integrated bill pay. With Coba, remote workers can live across two currencies... efficiently and effortlessly.
